      • getConversionSequence

        private static java.util.List<core.Term> getConversionSequence(core.Term initial,
                                                          core.Term goal,
                                                          core.Term convergence,
                                                          java.util.Map<core.Term,core.Term> leftSteps,
                                                          java.util.Map<core.Term,core.Term> rightSteps)
        Returns a list of terms that represents the conversion steps that were used in the conversion from the term initial to the term goal. This conversion is found using a Breadth-First Search starting from both initial and goal and a set of equations, which therefore creates two sets of terms, terms that can be found by rewriting initial and terms that can be found by rewriting goal. The map leftSteps stores for each term which term was used to create it, for all terms found by rewriting initial. This allows us to trace back the steps that were used for the conversion. rightSteps does the same for terms created by rewriting goal. When a term is found that is common to both sets of terms, there exists a conversion from initial to goal. There can be multiple common terms, convergence is one of those common terms.
        Parameters:
        initial - The initial term where the conversion starts
        goal - The final term where the conversion ends
        convergence - A term that both initial and goal can be rewritten to
        leftSteps - A map that links each term to the term that was used to create it, from convergence to initial
        rightSteps - A map that links each term to the term that was used to create it, from convergence to goal
        Returns:
        A list of terms which represents the conversion steps that were used to rewrite initial to goal
        See Also:
        core.Term
